CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 13, 1974, pg. 16 reads: "Well Earned Honor - Dr. and Mrs. Alexander L. Pierce, seated left, ewer special guests of honor at a brilliant banquet sponsored recently by the Allegheny Conference of the AME Zion Church, citing him for 64 years of service in the AME Zion preaching ministry. After serving 24 years as a Presiding Elder in the Allegheny Conference, Elder Pierce now in his ninties [sic] was retired by his request at the October '73 Annual Conference.  The Rt. Rev. C.H .Foggie, Presiding Bishop, who had also served in the pastorate under the supervision of Elder Pierce, suggested that an occasion of honor be planned for him.  Bishop and Mrs. Foggie are seated right.  Others in the picture, standing left to right are: Mrs. George Kendall, Presiding Elder and Mrs. A. Nicholson; Mrs. and Rev. George A. Fitch, host pastor and wife. - Harris Photo."image of unknown woman and Rev. Kendall in negative, masked when published by Pittsburgh Courier
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, seated from left: Mrs., and Dr. Alexander L. Pierce, guest of honor; Madeline Sharpe Foggie, and Bishop Charles Foggie; back row: unknown woman, Rev. and Mrs. George Kendall, Rev. Arizona Nicholson, Irene Nicholson, Carrie Fitch, and Rev. George A. Fitch, posed behind banquet table for retirement dinner at Homewood AME Church
